entries.name: new(size = 0, &block)
entries.desc: Creates a new pool with size connections that are created from the given block.

entries.name: empty?()
entries.desc: Returns true if there are no available connections.

entries.name: length()
entries.desc: The number of connections available on the stack.

entries.name: pop(timeout = 0.5, options = {})
entries.desc: Retrieves a connection from the stack.  If a connection is available it is immediately returned.  If no connection is available within the given timeout a Timeout::Error is raised.

entries.name: push(obj, options = {})
entries.desc: Returns obj to the stack.  options is ignored in TimedStack but may be used by subclasses that extend TimedStack.

entries.name: shutdown(&block)
entries.desc: Shuts down the TimedStack which prevents connections from being checked out.  The block is called once for each connection on the stack.
